Package ch.zhaw.theluckyseven.frantic.model.server_client_communication

Class NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection<T extends java.io.Serializable>

java.lang.Object
ch.zhaw.theluckyseven.frantic.model.server_client_communication.NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of Objects to be transmitted trough this connection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
Enclosing class:
NetworkHandler
public static class NetworkHandler.NetworkConnection<T extends java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
Network communication class representing a bidirectional connection between two peers (client and server), to send and receive Objects of type T. On the server side, the NetworkHandler.NetworkServer.waitForConnection() method is creating a matching instance for the connecting client.

  • Method Details

    • send

      public void send​(T data) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to send data to the opposite side. The call is sending out the requests immediately and returns if submitted successfully. Data can also be sent, while another thread is waiting for requests, but it has to be made sure that only one thread is sending data at a time (not thread-safe). If an error occurs a IOException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      data - data object of type T to be submitted through the connection.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs (e.g. connection interrupted while sending, ...)

    • receive

      public T receive() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Method to receive data from the opposite side. The call is blocking until a requests comes in, and the transferred object is returned. If the connection is closed during waiting, a SocketException is thrown, if the close was initiated locally or EOFException is thrown if the connection is closed from the remote side. Other IOException may be thrown on any another communication error.
      Returns:
      data object of type T received through the connection.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occours. (e.g. terminated locally/remotely) see above.
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the data object received does not match any class in the local classpath

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Indicates if the connection is open and connected to the peer.
      Returns:
      true if the connection is open and connected, false otherwise

    • isClosed

      public boolean isClosed()
      Indicate if the connection has been closed. A closed connection can not be reopened. To re-open, a new Instance must be created.
      Returns:
      true if the connection is closed, false otherwise.

    • getRemotePort

      public int getRemotePort()
      Returns the port number of the remote host, if the connection is available.
      Returns:
      port number (range: 1 - 65535) of the port on the remote host, 0 if not connected.

    • getRemoteHost

      public java.lang.String getRemoteHost()
      Returns the host name of the remote peer. If available looks up the hostname otherwise returns a string representation of the IP address
      Returns:
      host name of the remote peer, "not connected" if connection is not available.

    • close

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes this NetworkConnection and releases any system resources associated with it. If the connection is closed a SocketException is thrown on all local waiting threads (e.g. in receive()), and on the remote side an EOFException is thrown on all waiting threads. If the connection is already closed then invoking this method has no effect.
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.io.Closeable
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Method to compare two objects of NetworkHandler
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      o - object to compare
      Returns:
      true if the objects are equal

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object
